channel.title: Increase your Download and Upload Speed!
channel.description:
Increase your Download and Upload Speed!
I went from downloading 2.9 Mb/s to downloading 15.23 Mb/s. A lady from the FiOS Verizon DSL company told me about it and it worked very well! Download the TCP Optimizer on this page. http://www.speedguide.net/downloads.php
Before doing anything, try running a speed test before and after the change so you can see any differences. You can use this [url=http://www.speedtest.net/]Speed Test[/url] to accurately measure your speed. Make sure you're not downloading or uploading while the test is in progress.
Run the program and backup your settings by clicking on File > Backup current settings. Then change the top bar to your [b]Maximum Download Speed[/b]. You can get your Maximum download speed by talking with your ISP. I spoke with mine and they told me the max speed was 15 MB download so that is why I set it to 15 MB. Next click on "Optimal Settings" which is on the bottom. Here are my settings. [img]http://img90.imageshack.us/img90/904/tcpoptimizersettingsbv4.jpg[/img]
Click on Apply Changes, and then click on OK to save the changes. You will be prompted to restart your computer. Do so, and your speed should be much faster. I haven't tried any of the other settings yet, but feel free to. :)
Run the speed test again and post any changes. High chance that they will be very good!
[b]If the result is bad, then open the program and click on File > Restore backed up settings (if you backed up your settings) or Restore Windows Default settings.[/b]
~Ron :D

item.title: Increase your Download and Upload Speed!
item.dc:creator: @Schizzo Schizzo
item.description:
@Schizzo wrote:

The test says 1015 kb/s (kilobits). When you’re downloading, you see your speed in kB/s (kilobytes). kB/s = kb/s divided by 8.

So 1015 kb/s (what you saw when you took the speed test) divided by 8 = 127 kB/s (what you see when you download).

Read full topic

item.title: Increase your Download and Upload Speed!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

[quote=“nator123123, post:97, topic:32666”]Ron break rules! He post ware!

BTW, this didn’t help me much >_>[/quote]
This isn’t warez. Warez is software obtained illegally through patching, cracking, keygens, serials, and whatever else you can use get around buying the program.

This program is FREE.

52jaak:

thanks worked gr8 for me

Glad it helped man! It’s a pretty sweet utility.

ronny.m.p:

Hey, how do we get our maximum download speed?

Do you mean how much your maximum download speed should be? I asked my service provider. Ask your parents who your service provider is. Then get their number and call them up. They’ll ask you for your name/phone/ or whatever to prove you are the person that owns the account and then you can ask.

Once you get that number, set the max download speed in the utility to that number and you should get the maximum results.

Read full topic

item.title: Increase your Download and Upload Speed!
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Java Is My Bitch™:

Dropped my download speed using a download accelerator/ even less without it. 400 to 200. i set the bar to dif places. also people who are going less, you probably went higher, there is a difference KB and kb. KiloByes and Kilobites. i think thats correct, and if i’m also correct Kilobytes are higher than kilobites. But i might be wrong.

A kilobyte is 8 times a kilobit.
